TEI.2.document_title: William S. Hall to Stephen F. Austin, 07-08-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: William S. Hall to Austin, July 8, 1826. Asking information concerning election of militia officers.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1370

div1.p: William S. Hall to Austin, July 8, 1826. Asking information concerning election of militia officers.

Several enquiries having been made of me by individuals of this company relative to the late election of staff officers for this Battn on the 18 of March last and posponed agreably to the resolv of the Board of officers in order to afford time for the balance of the vots to be rendered in—understanding that the vots have been rendered in I vary respectfully solisit to know the result of that election and what persons have been elected Staff officers of this Battalion
To Lieu Col Steph F Austin
